title: 104_hr3759
content:
The "Exports, Jobs, and Growth Act of 1996" amends income levels and ceilings on investment insurance and financing under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. Income levels are adjusted to $1,280 or less and $5,556 or more in 1994 United States dollars. The ceiling on investment insurance is increased from $13,500,000,000 to $25,000,000,000. SEC. 102 amends the ceiling on investment insurance from $13.5 billion to $25 billion. SEC. 103 adjusts the ceiling on financing from $9.5 billion to $20 billion. SEC. 104 changes the issuing authority year from 1996 to 2001. SEC. 105 provides policy guidance. SEC. 104 amends the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 by changing the issuing authority year from 1996 to 2001. SEC. 105 amends policy guidance to increase US exports and complement trade policy. SEC. 106 establishes a Board of Directors. Section 233(b) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to remove certain sentences and make changes to the composition of the Board of Directors, including the addition of the United States Trade Representative and the option to designate a Deputy United States Trade Representative. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to change the composition of the Board of Directors, including the addition of the United States Trade Representative and the option to designate a Deputy United States Trade Representative. The President will designate a Chairman and Vice Chairman from among the Directors of the Board. TITLE II--TRADE AND DEVELOPMENT AGENCY

SEC. 201. TRADE AND DEVELOPMENT AGENCY AUTHORIZATION.

Section 661(f)(1)(A) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to authorize $40,000,000 for fiscal 1997 and necessary sums for fiscal year 1998.

TITLE III--EXPORT PROMOTION PROGRAMS WITHIN THE INTERNATIONAL TRADE ADMINISTRATION

SEC. 301. EXPORT PROMOTION AUTHORIZATION.

Section 202 of the Export Administration Amendments Act of 1985 is amended to authorize appropriations. SEC. 301. EXPORT PROMOTION AUTHORIZATION. Section 202 of the Export Administration Amendments Act of 1985 is amended to authorize appropriations of $240,000,000 for fiscal year 1997 and necessary sums for fiscal year 1998. TITLE IV--TRADE PROMOTION COORDINATING COMMITTEE SEC. 401. STRATEGIC EXPORT PLAN. SEC. 401 of TITLE IV involves amending the Export Enhancement Act of 1988 to identify ways to provide coordinated export promotion services for small- and medium-sized businesses and establish priorities for promoting US exports and free market reforms in the Middle East. The Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee is tasked with identifying and eliminating overlap and duplication in Federal export promotion activities, promoting better coordination between State, Federal, and private sector export promotion activities, and including these matters in the annual report by September 30, 1997. SEC. 403. PRIVATE SECTOR DEVELOPMENT IN THE UKRAINE. The Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee will report on efforts to promote US trade and investment for private sector development in Ukraine in the 1997 annual report.
